original: LINDSSTRÖM, Carl Gunnar Olof, Civilingenjör, Solsidan, Saltsjöbaden, f Eskelhem, Gotl, 12/5 99 av sjökapt T G L o Maria Ahlberg, gm Sylvia .Johanson. Studex Visby 18, ord stud KTH (E) 19—23, ASEA:s 2-åriga elevkurs 18 o 25—26. Anst v ASEA i Västerås 26, v ASEA:s armaturavd i Sthlm 26—32, v AB Liljeholmens Kabelfabr 32—43 o v ASEA:s avd f installationsmtrl i Sthlm sed. 43. Led 1 Sv Tekn.frn fr 23. Resor: Tyskl, Frankr. Engl o USA 32 (stip fr KTH ur Glödlamp-fabr:s stip.f ond), internat bely sn.kongr i Paris 37, Tyskl 38. Vpl löjtn sed. 44. Medl av Gotl Gille, Vpl officerares Frn, Frn Sveriges Flotta. Av trycket: Upps i belysningstekn fråg. Hobbies: Böcker, friluftsliv, trädgårdsskötsel.
translated: LINDSSTRÖM, Carl Gunnar Olof, Civil Engineer, Solsidan, Saltsjöbaden, born in Eskelhem, Gotland, on May 12th, 1899, son of sea captain T. G. Lindsström and Maria Ahlberg. Married to Sylvia Johanson. Completed studies in Visby in 1918, and studied at the Royal Institute of Technology (Electrical Engineering) from 1919 to 1923. Attended ASEA's 2-year apprentice course in 1918 and from 1925 to 1926. Employed at ASEA in Västerås in 1926, at ASEA's lighting department in Stockholm from 1926 to 1932, at AB Liljeholmens Cable Factory from 1932 to 1943, and at ASEA's department for installation materials in Stockholm from 1943 onwards. Member of the Swedish Technical Association since 1923. Traveled to Germany, France, England, and the USA in 1932 (received a scholarship from KTH out of the Incandescent Lamp Factory's scholarship fund), attended international lighting congresses in Paris in 1937 and Germany in 1938. Became a Second Lieutenant in 1944. Member of the Gotland Guild, the Armed Officers' Association, and the Swedish Navy. Published on lighting technology topics. Hobbies include books, outdoor activities, and gardening.
